abstracts.cdata!:
The Bihar Plateau Development Project
            was reasonably successful in achieving its objectives.
            However, the project was rated as a "problem
            project" during May-November 1997. Major effort by
            project management and Bank supervision teams since 1997 led
            to the achievement of most project outputs. Based on the
            review of the project implementation experience, lessons
            learned are include: a) Readiness for implementation is
            crucial to completion of the project on schedule and
            achievement of its development objectives. b) Infrastructure
            projects such as for the provision of drinking water to
            families are ideal for encouraging responsibility for user
            group operation and upkeep. c) Where projects leave choice
            of individual items to be financed to be made during
            implementation there needs to be a very careful system for
            screening their sustainability and ranking them so that they
            can be fully justified as priority needs. d) Close
            involvement of beneficiaries form project design through
            implementation is required for easy implementation and
            improved sustainability. e) Close attention to development
            of sound plans for operation and maintenance from
            preparation onwards is necessary in order to have confidence
            in subsequent project sustainability.
